PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BOLINGER SEGARS GILBERT AND MOSS LLP

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE CHILDRENS' HOME OF LUBBOCK.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE CHILDREN'S HOME FOUNDATION EXISTS TO SECURE AND MANAGE FUNDS FOR THE SOLE BENEFIT OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK. THROUGH A MISSION OF SAFEKEEPING AND WISE MANAGEMENT, THE DIRECTORS OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME FOUNDATION PLEDGE THEIR COMMITMENT TO THE GOALS OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK TO PROVIDE PROTECTION AND LOVE TO CHILDREN CAUGHT IN THE CROSSFIRES OF LIFE, SO THEY MAY GROW IN GRACE AND GIVE THEIR UNIQUE GIFTS TO THE WORLD. IN SHORT, THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK AND ITS MINISTRY OF "MANIFESTING CHRIST THROUGH EXCELLENCE IN CHILD CARE."
IRS990.Desc: FUNDING TO TAX-EXEMPT ENTITY PROVIDING CARE FOR DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN.

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK & FAMILY SERVICES AGENCY INC

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION HAS JOINT MEETINGS WITH THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION. THIS ALLOWS THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION TO KNOW WHAT THE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION IS DOING. THE PRESIDENT OF THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION SERVES ON THE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION'S BOARD AND THAT THEY ARE AUTOMATICALLY ON THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE. THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE IS IN CHARGE OF DETERMINING HOW INVESTMENTS WILL BE INVESTED. ALLOWING THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION TO HAVE THEIR PRESIDENT ON THE COMMITTEE ALLOWS THEM TO HAVE A VOICE IN HOW ASSETS ARE INVESTED.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: REAL ESTATE INV. TRUST - CHURCH LOANS AND INVESTMENTS

PRIVATE EQUITY GROUP INTEREST - MCALISTER OPP FUND 2012

LIMITED PARTNER - HARBERT CREDIT SOLUTIONS FUND V FEEDER LP
LIMITED PARTNER - HARBERT CREDIT SOLUTIONS FUND IV, LP
LIMITED PARTNER - HARBERT MEZZANINE PARTNERS III, LP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK & FAMILY SERVICES AGENCY, INC., A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN.

THE FOUNDATION ACCOUNTS FOR INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH INCOME TAX ACCOUNTING GUIDANCE IN FASB ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES. THE PRIMARY POSITION OF THE FOUNDATION IS ITS FILING STATUS AS A TAX EXEMPT ENTITY. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS REFLECTED IN THE FOUNDATION'S TAX FILINGS AND DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS EXIST.
RENTAL EXPENSES RECLASSED AGAINST RENTAL INCOME 87.
RENTAL EXPENSES RECLASSED AGAINST RENTAL INCOME 87.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK & FAMILY SERVICES AGENCY INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL ADVISORS ARE SOMETIMES USED TO FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT PRESENTED A COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD FOR DISCUSSION, REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY EACH DIRECTOR AND OFFICER SHALL SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS SUCH PERSON HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY; HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY; AND HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS THE DIRECTOR OR OFFICER MUST DISCLOSE THIS FACT TO THE WHOLE BOARD AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AND RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM VOTING ON ANY VOTE RELATED TO THEIR CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS TO DISCUSS AND REVIEW COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEE OFFICERS. THE COMMITTEE THEN PRESENTS THEIR RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE BOARD THEN VOTES ON APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION FOR THE EMPLOYEE OFFICER. THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY OTHER EMPLOYEES, BESIDES THE TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL, THAT QUALIFIES AS AN OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE. THEREFORE, LINE 15B HAS BEEN ANSWERED NO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING BY THE PUBLIC AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE IN LUBBOCK, TX.

THE COMPENSATION REPORTED IN COLUMN E AND F ARE RELATED TO MR MOORE'S POSITION AS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK. PER IRS REGULATIONS THE CHILDREN'S HOME IS A RELATED ORGANIZATION AND ALL COMPENSATION FROM A RELATED ORGANIZATION MUST BE REPORTED ON THE FORM 990. MR. MOORE DOES NOT RECEIVE ANY COMPENSATION FROM THE FOUNDATION, AND IS ON THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD STRICTLY AS A VOLUNTEER.
THE BOARD AS A WHOLE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT AND SELECTING THE INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITOR.
